notes.observation: Rajesh completed the customer segmentation analysis and presented findings to the executive team. His analysis was thorough, data-driven, and included actionable recommendations. The exec team specifically praised the clarity of his presentation and the business value of the insights. This work directly informed our Q4 marketing strategy.

Rajesh built an automated reporting dashboard using Tableau that replaced several manual weekly reports. This saves the analytics team approximately 8 hours per week. He documented the process and trained other analysts on how to maintain it. Great example of working smarter, not harder.

Rajesh has been excellent at partnering with the product team. He proactively reaches out to understand their data needs, attends their planning meetings, and provides quick turnaround on ad-hoc analysis requests. The product managers have specifically mentioned how much they value his partnership.

Rajesh organized and led a workshop on SQL best practices for the analytics team. He created excellent training materials that we can reuse. Several junior analysts mentioned this was the most useful training they've received. He's becoming a go-to resource for SQL and database optimization questions.

During the quarterly business review prep, Rajesh went beyond just pulling numbers. He identified trends in customer behavior that weren't initially on our radar and proposed hypotheses for what's driving them. His strategic thinking adds significant value beyond technical execution.

Rajesh's work is consistently high quality. His analyses are rigorous, his code is clean and well-commented, and he's thorough about validating data before sharing insights. I rarely need to review his work for errors. This reliability is valuable in a senior analyst.
